com:
/vmg/ is a place to discuss all types of mobile games, including both Android and iOS, phones and tablets. Please note that Nintendo and Sony handhelds are considered consoles, and that threads pertaining to those platforms and their gaming titles should be posted elsewhere.

Does this mean discussion of mobile games is banned on other video game boards? No! /vmg/ is just a separate board specifically focused on mobile games where discussions about your favorite games can thrive.

Please familiarize yourself with the rules and remember to use the spoiler function where appropriate!

Please note that, like /v/, "Generals"—long-term, one-after-the-other, recurring threads about a specific game are not permitted on /vmg/. Such threads belong on >>>/vg/

>>1068604
You might wanna invest on some melee queens because Guilford is pretty weak in my experience and Jeremiah's main use is to deploy and retreat immediately instead of staying to fight.
The MC is a good choice even if you don't have their personal mechs yet. C.C. works as a subtank because she can block up to 3 enemies with the Lancelot. Her defense is not as good as actual tanks though so keep an eye on her.
I see the 1*s in your team are leveled and I sure hope you didn't use your exp chips for that. Invest on Milly to replace Inoue because she gives an ATK boost and reduces the cost for Ashford pilots (Lelouch, Suzaku, MC, Kallen, and herself). Work on Kewell if you have him because he and Viletta will be your standard AA pilots.
Oh, and if you have some double drop radars, you might wanna use them on the weekends because the drops from the exp chip missions are doubled and then do the hardest mission if you can.

Now here's some pilots I suggest you work on once you're done with the above.
>4* Kallen
Kallen does what Jeremiah does while also filling half of your units' skill gauge on deployment.
>3* SUZAK
Tank that hits a bit harder than Tohdoh and can block up to 6 enemies in Lancelot (he'll die while doing this). You'll eventually want more tanks as the map gets wider and you have more routes to block.
>2* Diethard
The only guy in the game (other than limited halloween Lelouch) that gives Stealth to your units. Faggots with rifles and bazookas who stops just outside your unit's LOS to shoot them will be forced to come closer.
>3* Lelouch
Stuns everyone in his LOS for a few seconds. Really good, but I'm too smoothbrain to use Kings and I managed to finish the main story without him.

last_replies.com:
>>1068343
Any? Bringing as amulet Influence would help getting your hands in more legendary items. If you are to bring another amulet, then Gambling pieces alongside 1 Alchemy piece at least. The problem with Gambling is they don't help that much in harder level dungeons, so it's common to roll Influence before completing your Eternal Dark overkill build.

Basically, you will be hitting for 9,999,999 damage 30 times per skill use and pooping hundreds of barriers as you do that. Since you're killing everything in a single turn, then Alert. Since you don't want to get petrified by your multihits and have so many barriers (if you are not equipping Vitality), then Blood Armor. Mirror would help not kys against reflect in PvP, but then you can play as Fairy or use Fairy Wings and relax. You may also consider Willpower instead of Limit Break (as rolling Umbilical Cord is a common thing). And consider not equipping Eternal Dark, but rolling it twice with Influence alone, depending on your job.

Eternal Dark *is* the build lol

Dissolve or Black Hole are decent amulets to take, I prefer Dissolve since you will probably encounter every "stat = HP" thing and/or Almighty. Anything is good because you'll get pretty much every good Legendary trait at some point. Just bring safety parts/contracts or movement parts/contracts, or you could even go Party Time, stick it on Dog, and have an all in one farming machine. I've done that a couple times and that's how I farmed all of the Disaster modifiers like One Rope or Transparent while also farming 100k Fragments of Death. You definitely want Gamblings, though, and Scavenger is probably one of the better classes to stick it on if you aren't using Dog or something else to specifically farm stuff. Scavenger is a good "let's explore Eternal Dark" class

last_replies.com:
>>1064973
It scans them as they are uploaded to the icloud but before the cloud receives it, really just a checksum to compare them to see if the photo matches a known cp photo in the database. It doesnt even send a copy of the photo it just compares image data to known flagged images. Part of it is client side but unless the file you are sending is already in a cp database it wont activate.

Again if you are not uploading to icloud there will be no scan, and even if there is a scan the images themselves are never sent. Its just a math formula that is sent in for comparison before icloud accepts the image. No one is getting photos from your phone unless you are actively sharing and uploading them.

There are far more invasive things going on in chinashit apps than any of this.

To the people derailing Genshin and Hoyoverse games, and to the fans: There is obviously shilling going on. They will deny it but if you spend time on /pol/ or are an oldfag smarty pants like me, you can see it from a mile away. Allow me to point out a few facts:

1. Genshin is quasi-political, it has made China loads of money, and is helping contribute to important projects outside of gaming.

2. Arguing and gaslighting derail threads, preventing positive conversations from flourishing. See “Snowden’s leaks” for tips on how people derail threads.

3. The game(s) isn’t/aren’t all about sexy women and high stats. There’s loads of art, lore, music, and fun to be had within the Hoyoverse and you don’t even have to pay for it.

4. Being racist towards China and/or having strong negative beliefs about China belongs on /pol/ or /b/. Maybe even /k/. But not here. You of course CAN say things like “chink” if you want, but it’s not very mature or productive.

5. Multiple Hoyoverse type threads have been derailed and/or have devolved into arguments.

Ignore the naysayers, so they don’t get a “you”. They will try to suck you into confrontation, and always fight to get the last word. Don’t engage. Ignore and have fun, enjoy your internet and gaming time. Much love <3

>>1052890
I wouldn't mind PC versions, but I enjoy games where numbers go up and I can freely play how the fuck I want without the game sending me down linear pathways until the credits run.
Sadly few videogames do this nowadays, and to my surprise the mobile sector is full of it. It's not telling me who or what to invest into. It doesn't give a shit that I don't want to do the story now, but later. No big hallway to follow down when it comes to progression, but I can do what I think I need.

I know, not everyone cares, but I like those kind of games. And when Rpgs on pc/consoles became dogshit because everything has to be boring and linear to the point they cut even out rewarding exploration, I may as well play mobile games. Some of them do even HAVE rewarding exploration nowadays, though they are usually played better on PC.
That said, most mobile games still suck ass. Gotta find what's nice for you.

tl;dr: I like to be able to think myself on how I play the game, and for whatever goddamn reason the mobile game sector is much better with that than offline games are nowadays. Sadly so.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>1065291
I wouldn't know, anon. Browsing through the popular and unpopular titles makes it look like an uphill battle to do honest business where you intend to offer high quality, reasonably priced/monetized software.
Freetards take mobile gaming for granted, don't care about ads or block them, won't pay even 20 cents upfront, and if they have some pocket change, they'd rather blow it on gachashit jpegs. Some devs cope by releasing a part of the game or even the whole thing for free and including an IAP with more content. Some offer a free version with ads and a paid version without ads + some extra stuff, and man, the difference in downloaded copies is hefty.
Google seems to hate ad-free games, both paid and free, so you'll have to shill your game on your own. There are many nice games that fail to get more than ten thousand or even one hundred downloads. I think the numbers on the super popular games are padded with fake traffic from chink sweatshops, who knows. Some of the popular games have a Steam version, I guess that's a way to get extra exposure.
>make a good RPG and charge $5
That price range includes games such as Stardew Valley, Out There, or Ticket to Earth so the competition looks fierce.
